content.description:
Start the same as

Glass Traverse

and traverse right for about 4' to a vertical seam with amazing incut holds. Continue up the stepped arete and finish just left a slot.

This problem isn't listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Left side of the southwest face.

content.description: Traverse right along a juggy rail for about 15' and then head up a vertical crack with jugs to an incut finish. Worth doing over and over.
content.location: Start on the left side of the southwest face and traverses right for15' to a juggy vertical crack.

content.description:
Sit start with hands on a good sharp crimp.   With nothing for the feet pull on and bust a move up left for a sloper jug.   From here pull hard and with use of a micro crimp gain hight to reach the better holds.

Finish directly up and over.

This problem isn't listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.

content.location: Left side of the southwest face.

content.description:
Start the same as

Glass Direct

but move right along a thin seam to a sloping rail then power up to an incut rail with marginal feet and higher to a juggy horizontal to finish with the juggy crack of

Glass Traverse

.

SDS at a slanting flake and work up past incut flakes to a horizontal and amazing incut features to the top. Quality.

Rated V1 in the Tram Bouldering guide but it seems a little easier than that.
